Body: Description: Many of our reports have data from servers that were decomissioned years ago. For example, the OpenAccess reports have folders and shares that havent existed in 2 years. How can I make sure the outdated data is purged so we know the data we are looking at is accurate?
Invitation updated. Attendees: No attendees listed
Invitation updated. Attendees: Joshua Sexton, Amir Sardarizadeh
Next Steps Updated: wait for client to schedule meeting

What We've Learned Updated: provided client with KB to drop old FS data for decom'd hosts

client requested assistance over remote session

zoom meeting

plan for meeting is to create and run a job to drop data for old decommissioned servers

 

following KB: How to Drop Data for Decommissioned File Servers

 

client is currently going though list of servers to identify all the servers that need removed

 

created a "Decommissioned Hosts" host list

pointed new dropFSdata job at Decommissioned Hosts list

 

ran job from schedule

disabled job

 

---------------

 

client is interested in health check

look at hosts lists, job scheduling, SEEK scan

-some servers throwing errors but it is still scanning

What We've Learned Updated: we removed the old decom'd server data from the database, but the client says some data is still showing on reports with !Removed in front of it.

This usually means the FSDropTables job didn't finish properly
I had him run it a couple more times and it seems to be finishing but he said its better but he still sees some instances of !Removed in reports

I asked for more details on which reports and servers are still showing !Removed

I haven't gotten a response
Next Steps Updated: waiting for client to provide examples of reports with !Removed still showing
